component.name: Switch
component.description: Enable or disable a binary system setting with immediate effect.

useCases: Toggling a system feature on or off

commonPatterns.name: labeled-switch
commonPatterns.description: Switch with an associated label describing the setting

commonPatterns.name: small-switch
commonPatterns.description: Compact switch for dense layouts or secondary settings

commonPatterns.name: controlled-switch
commonPatterns.description: Controlled switch with checked state and callback

antiPatterns.reason: Switch implies binary system state, not item selection
antiPatterns.alternative: Use Checkbox for item selection in lists or forms

antiPatterns.scenario: Using Switch for choosing between more than two options
antiPatterns.alternative: Use RadioGroup or ToggleGroup for multi-option selection

antiPatterns.scenario: Using Switch for mode or tool selection
antiPatterns.reason: Mode/tool toggling has different interaction semantics
antiPatterns.alternative: Use Toggle for mode or tool on/off state

slots.switch: Root toggle track; manages checked/unchecked state

interactions.click: Toggles between checked and unchecked states
interactions.keyboard: Space to toggle; Tab to navigate
interactions.focus: Visible 3px focus ring on focus-visible; border changes to ring color
interactions.hover: No explicit hover style; relies on cursor pointer

accessibility.keyboardSupport: Space to toggle; Tab to navigate

Label should describe the resulting state, not the action
Always pair with a Label for accessibility

aiHints.context: If the label reads as a sentence describing system state (e.g., 'Enable notifications'), use Switch. Switch implies immediate effect. For mode/tool toggling with button-like appearance, use Toggle instead. For form checkboxes that require submission, use Checkbox.
